summary: In response to COVID-19 , the Federal Reserve System Board of Governors authorized 13 emergency lending programs to help provide credit to certain parts of the economy, including businesses and employers. The Main Street Lending Program targeted small and mid-sized businesses and nonprofits. Since the program ended in January 2021, borrowers have generally made scheduled payments on-time. As of August 2023, about 64% of program...
title: Federal Reserve Lending Programs: Status of Monitoring and Main Street Lending Program
